short_summary: Removal and disposal of hazardous material from various locations on Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Halifax
description: The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of the Department of National Defence has a requirement for a Regional Individual Standing Offer to provide services of removal, transportation, and disposing of generated hazardous material on an as and when requested basis to various locations of Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Halifax within the Halifax Regional Municipality
full_summary:
==========================


### Tender Solicitation: Removal and Disposal of Hazardous Material

**Notice Number:** WS4639197087


**Publication Date:** July 22, 2024


**Closing Date:** August 8, 2024, at 2:00 PM


### Background

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) invites bids from qualified contractors for a Regional Individual Standing Offer to provide removal, transportation, and disposal of hazardous material services on an as and when requested basis to various locations within the Halifax Regional Municipality.


### Notice Type and Type of Solicitation

*   Notice Type: Request for Standing Offer
*   Type of Solicitation: Competitive - Open Bidding


### Provisioning and Contract

*   Trade Agreements: The procurement is covered under various trade agreements, including the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, and the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).
*   Procurement Category: Service - Maintenance and Repair (SRV)
*   Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
*   Selection Criteria: Lowest Price


### Technical Specifications

*   Service to be Provided: Removal, transportation, and disposal of hazardous materials
*   Service Area: Various locations within the Halifax Regional Municipality
*   Service Duration: The standing offer will be valid from issuance to June 30, 2026, with two optional one-year periods


### Tender Requirements

*   Interested bidders must submit their bids electronically through the Ariba Discovery platform
*   Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada
*   Tender responses must be referenced to the solicitation


### Contact Information

*   Contracting Authority: PSPC
*   Contact Information: Sonia Stockman, sonia.stockman@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca


### Evaluation Criteria

*   The evaluation criteria will be subject to a pass-fail evaluation process based on the lowest computed price
*   Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation within 15 working days from receipt of notification that their bid was unsuccessful. *   Reference the solicitation for further details. *   Please refer to the Commonwealth of Australia's official website [www.tenders.gov.au](http://www.tenders.gov.au) for any further information.
